snippet: The Ford Motor Company’s board will meet this week to consider possible succession plans for the company’s chief executive, Alan R. Mulally.
abstract: Ford Motor Company's board plans to meet to consider possible succession plans for company's chief executive, Alan R Mulally; Bloomberg News report says board is preparing to promote Mark Fields, president of company's North and South American operations, to job of chief operating officer, a move that would signal that he is in line to succeed Mulally; Ford declines comment on speculation.
lead_paragraph: The Ford Motor Company’s board will meet this week to consider possible succession plans for the company’s chief executive, Alan R. Mulally.

headline.seo: Ford Considers Succession Plans for Chief Executive
headline.main: In Refining Succession Plans, Ford May Name a New No. 2
headline.print_headline: In Refining Succession Plans, Ford May Name a New No. 2
